116

Growing from compacted soil covered in moss in open mixed oak woodland near Northern Red Oak, Eastern Red Cedar, Black Oak, Roughleaf Dogwood, and distant Chinkapin Oak trees. 
3cm tall and 6cm wide.

- Cap and hymenophore fairly flexible for a Russula species.
- Gills appear almost waxy. 
- Trama gritty, cellular, apple-like.
- Taste: Slowly acrid. 
- KOH slowly turning light orange on trama near the cap margin.
